intro: Nonea alpestris, commonly known as the alpine nonea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and grasslands. Nonea alpestris is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
